intro: Kickxia brunneri subsp. dichondrifolia, commonly known as the two-leafed false brome, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, greenish to brownish flowers. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
